intro: Corydalis uncinata, commonly known as the hooked corydalis, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often clustered at the base. Corydalis uncinata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. Its unique floral structure and medicinal properties have made it a subject of interest in both horticulture and traditional medicine.
